results.title: Maidens in uniform = Girls in uniform = Madchen in uniform
results.creator_credit: Carl Froelich, Deutsche Filmgemeinschaft and Leontine Sagan
results.brief_description: Central to the film, set in a boarding school for the daughters of German officers prior to World War I, is the intense relationship between a young student and her female teacher. Interwoven emotional and institutional pressures result in near tragedy. The atmosphere of Prussian authoritarianism in the school is expertly evoked and the film has long been seen as an attack on German militarism and was suppressed by the Nazis. Causing an uproar on its release because of its frank handling of lesbianism, it was rediscovered in the seventies and has now taken its place as a classic of gay cinema. Director Leontine Sagan had been trained by Max Reinhardt and was already a prominent stage actress. Soon afterwards she came to England to direct a film for Alexander Korda. Cast includes Dorothea Wieck, Hertha Thiele, Emilia Unda and Ellen Schwannecke. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Maidens
results.brief_description: A compilation documentary of four generations of the filmmaker’s maternal family from 1906-1977 using images from old family photographs, slides, home movies and excerpts from historical Australian women’s films. The images trace the transition of the family from the extended family functioning as a productive unit on the land to the nuclear family and by the fourth generation into further disintegration and change into a yet to be defined form. Parts 1 & 11 illustrate the historical development of the image and its use by families in reading personal history. Parts 3 & 4 juxtapose fictional dramatic films in which the filmmaker appears with cinema verite and home movies thus exploring the relationship between filmic representation and reality. First Prize, General Section, Greater Union Awards, Sydney Film Festival 1978. Gold Hugo, Best Short Subject Film, Chicago Film Festival 1978.

results.title: Mahratta: an experience shared
results.creator_credit: Australian Instructional Films, Bank of New South Wales and Lex Halliday
results.brief_description: The Mahratta Senior Staff College of the Bank of New South Wales which was established in 1817 with a staff of two, now provides training facilities for large numbers of employees including the Senior Staff College, Mahratta. Potential executives and managers attend an intensive course of lectures, discussions, study and report writing. The facilities of the college building and extracts from lectures, discussions and the lighter side of college life are shown.

results.title: Mahatma Gandhi
results.brief_description: Photographs and newsreel shots are used in documenting the highlights of the life of Mohandas Gandhi, India’s political and spiritual leader. Traces Gandhi’s efforts to gain freedom for his people - the “homespun” program which stimulated production; the march to the sea in 1930 to protest against oppressive British excise taxes on salt; the movements to free the ostracised untouchables and to give women political equality. Discusses the effectiveness of Gandhi’s philosophy of non-violent resistance.

results.title: Mahatma and the mad boy
results.creator_credit: Merchant Ivory Productions and Ismail Merchant
results.brief_description: A comment on poverty and wealth filmed in Bombay, the central characters being the “mad” boy, his monkey and a statue of Mahatma Ghandi. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Mahalia
results.creator_credit: Richard St Johns, Roha Enterprises, Marconlee, Graham Lee Mahin and Allen H Miner
results.brief_description: This documentary is a portrait of one of the world’s finest gospel singers, a warm and sincere woman with strong religious faith and an unquestioning belief in humanity, the wonderful Miss Mahalia Jackson. Filmed on location in London, Stockholm, Berlin and many other European cities during her inspirational European tour, Mahalia finds time between performances to talk about her background, her lifetime passion for spreading the gospel beyond the church through concert appearances and album recordings, and her commitment to championing the causes of justice, freedom and peace in the world. It was shortly after this triumphant tour that Mahalia Jackson passed away (1972). However her legacy lives on. Songs in this film include “Didn’t it rain”, “He’s got the whole world in his hands”, “Just a closer walk with thee”, “We shall overcome” and many other favourites. Narrated by Brock Peters.

results.title: Magnus and the beansteak
results.creator_credit: John Fairley, Harris Watts and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Scientists”.
The views of food technologist, Magnus Pyke on the production of synthetic foods derived from soya beans and chemicals, that could prevent heart disease and help to feed some of the world’s undernourished population.

results.title: Magnum photos: the changing of a myth [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: Magnum Photos was founded in New York in 1947 and established as a centre for photo-journalism where the photographer owned the copyright and was allowed the freedom and integrity to produce their own work. Its ideals were high, just like the four photographers who created Magnum Photos - George Rodger, David Seymour (aka Chim), Henri Cartier-Bresson and Robert Capa and the intention of this co-operative was to create an ongoing pool of 50 professional photographers who, with shared beliefs about their photography, could go and cover every conceivable aspect of the human condition across the globe. In this documentary, German filmmaker Reiner Holzemer introduces some of the internationally recognised photographers currently with Magnum Photos and joins them in their field work in various parts of the world, including England with Martin Parr, Canada with Larry Towell, and Northern Ireland with Donovan Wylie. Also includes interviews with Philip Jones Griffiths, Eve Arnold, Marc Riboud, Burt Glinn, Rene Burri, Luc Delahay among others and provides an illuminating insight into the workings of Magnum Photos, considered one of today’s most prestigious photo agencies. Contains many great photo-images, some that are instantly recognisable, and provides an interesting and informative program on the topic of photography and photo-journalism. Commentary by Mike Lucas.

results.title: Magnum force
results.creator_credit: Robert Daley, Warner Bros Pictures and Ted Post
results.brief_description: The second “Dirty Harry” movie, “Magnum Force” concerns itself with a vigilante group that has targeted notorious criminals whose power and influence have made them immune from prosecution. When a prominent gang boss is set free by the air-headed liberal courts, he is soon exterminated by an avenging motorcycle cop. While Detective Harry Callahan is no great friend of civil liberties, he is dead set against wholesale murder as a solution to legal loopholes. Discovering that all the killings have been committed by a .357 Magnum, Callahan suspects his on-the-edge ex-partner is responsible. But the conspiracy is less transparent than that, as Harry learns, almost at the cost of his own life. Co-scripted by John Milius and Michael Cimino. Cast includes Clint Eastwood, Hal Holbrook, Mitchell Ryan, Felton Perry and David Soul.
